snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio often celebrates the multiethnic fabric of New York, but for the city’s Irish, his young mayoralty has been perceived as a series of slights and indignities.
abstract: Mayor Bill de Blasio often celebrates the multi-ethnic fabric of New York, but for the city's Irish, his young mayoralty has been perceived as series of slights and indignities; City Hall officials, caught off-guard by brewing frustration among Irish groups accustomed to outsize role in city's political life, are scrambling to make amends.

byline.original: By MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM and NIKITA STEWART

lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio often celebrates the multiethnic fabric of New York, but for the city’s Irish, his young mayoralty has been perceived as a series of slights and indignities.

headline.main: Amid Mayoral Missteps and Snubs of Parades, Irish Eyes Are Rolling in New York
headline.print_headline: Amid Mayoral Missteps and Disdain for Parades, Irish Eyes Are Rolling
